bug.short_desc: wildcard in #asset causes "Nested comment" in editor

long_desc.thetext:
When passing the JsonToTree demo to the playground the editor will report "Nested comment. Stopping, unable to continue. (26% scanned)." on line 23. The problem is the wildcard in the #asset since it is in a commented block:
#asset(qx/icon/${qx.icontheme}/16/mimetypes/*)

Thats interesting and true. Thats what the spec says about nested comments
7.4 Comments Comments can be either single or multi-line. Multi-line comments cannot nest.
So it is a lucky coincidence that this is working in the browsers.

The main thing is that you don't use the comment terminating sequence '*/' within a comment. So an embedded comment start sequence is permissible and usually accepted: /* ... /* ... */, but not: /* ... */ ... */
(Crockford's JsLint is overly picky here).
But the issue remains that wildcard expressions in #asset hints (and #ignore hints, btw) may run into the hard issue of a comment terminating sequence:
#asset(qx/icon/${qx.icontheme}/*/mimetypes)
A probably good solution would be using a wildcard character other than "*" for the same purpose. This would eliminate all those problems and avoid any ambiquity with comment chars. "?" or "~" would be good candidates, as both are not legal JS identifier chars (and "?" being known from shell globs). Although resource id's could in principle contain those characters, I would consider that bad practice (JS identifiers are enforced for class paths, and the resource paths should follow suite).
